line.text: Shall I compare thee to a summer day
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Thou art more lovely and more temperate
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And summer lease hath all too short a date
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Sometime too hot the eye of heaven shines
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And often is his gold complexion dimmed
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And every fair from fair sometime declines
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: By chance or nature changing course untrimmed
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: But thy eternal summer shall not fade
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Nor lose possession of that fair thou ow
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Nor shall death brag thou wandrest in his shade
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: When in eternal lines to time thou grow
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: So long as men can breathe or eyes can see
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: So long lives this and this gives life to thee
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
